summary: The U.S. Attorney's Office for the District of Oregon today announced criminal charges against a man accused of sexually abusing two of his granddaughters.  According to the SEC's complaint, filed in federal court in Portland, Oregon, on January 24, 2019, Michael J. Baughman, a convicted felon, was charged with two counts of first-degree sexual abuse based on allegations that defendant touched his daughter’s vagina and put his penis in her mouth. The complaint alleges that, when confronted by his daughter, JB, who is also a victim of the alleged abuse, defendant denied the allegations and consented to the entry of a final judgment that permanently enjoins him from violating the antifraud provisions of Section 17(a) of the Securities Act of 1933, Section 10(b) of Securities Exchange Act of 1934 and Rule 10b-5 thereunder, and Sections 206(1), 206(2), and 206(4) of Exchange Act Rule 206(3) of 1940. The SEC seeks a permanent injunction, disgorgement of ill-gotten gains plus prejudgment interest, and a civil penalty.  The SEC's investigation was conducted by David A. Williams and supervised by Jennifer C. Barry. The litigation will be led by Mr. Williams. The case is being supervised by C.J. Kerstetter. The Office of the United States Attorney for the Eastern District of New York has issued anÂ Investor AlertÂ to encourage investors toÂ check the background of anyone selling or offering them an investment using the free and simple search tool on Investor.gov.Â  The SEC appreciates the assistance of the Federal Bureau of Investigation and the Office of Inspector General of the Department of Justice in this matter.
